hy: I have a real problem here ... last week, I made a irc server on my pc. all worked fine. on the second day, port 6667 and many other ports were closed for global using, including port 80. the users from my internet network from my city can access it, but nobody else can ! any suggestion ?

I have a real problem here ... last week, I made a irc server on my pc. all worked fine. on the second day, port 6667 and many other ports were closed for global using, including port 80. the users from my internet network from my city can access it, but nobody else can ! and the ports that I need are opened in my firewall and in iptables... any suggestions please  ?

I have a real problem here ... last week, I made a irc server on my pc. all worked fine. on the second day, port 6667 and many other ports were closed for global using, including port 80. the users from my internet network from my city can access it, but nobody else can ! and the ports that I need are opened in my firewall and in iptables... any suggestions please  ?
kind *
ok :|
as far I know.
I tried many ways .. reconfigured firewall.. but nothing worked.
I don't use a domain name
are you connecting using your ip address instead of a name server?
connecting on what ?
the irc server
are you using any type of firewall in ubuntu ?
yes, quicktables.
have you made sure all ports are open in quicktables? dumb question, but gotta ask lol
Yes. all open
is your irc server running now?
no, I stopped it when I saw that the ports are down
did you change the ports?
I changed only the ssh port. that's all.
sorry but i can't help you. =(
